chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alejandro Solero-Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Motion Hearing on 2/4/16 before Judge Falstad.  
Includes 15CF176 and 15CF293.

IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding the postconviction motion is retroactively extended to February 9, 2016.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal is extended to April 1, 2016
includes 15CF176 & 15CF293
Appeal No. 2016XX297-CR

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:12pm
INCLUDES 15CF176 & 15CF293
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher; Deft appears in person with Atty Leonhard Kachinski. Spanish interpreter- Darrius Torres appears.
Date and time set for motion to vacate probation disposition order

Spanish interpreter sworn in and interprets
Date and time set for defendants motion for post conviction
Atty Kachinski makes statement regarding vacating probationary dispositional order and impose consecutive prison term
COURT imposed disposition because it was joint recommendation
State says they would have argued for consecutive prison time if deft was not under terms of deportation from country
Atty Kachinski makes statement
COURT makes findings and sentenced deft as was due to joint recommendation
COURT denies defense's post conviction motion

Adj: 3:26pm

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 11:10am. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 15CF176, 15CF293, 15TR1099, 15TR1010. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Interpreter, Teresa Berger sworn & interprets. State recites agreement and makes statement. COURT addresses name of defendant.  Atty Bohn states that Defendant's name is SOTERO not SOLERO. COURT addresses Defendant as Mr. Sotero. 
*VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (OAR) 15CF176- crt grants. State moves to Amend Information in 15CF293 from (OWI-5th) to (OWI - 6th).  Atty Bohn waives reading.  COURT grants Amended Information in 15CF293. State moves to DI ct 2 (PAC) & DRI ct 2 (Operate w/out valid dl) 15CF293- crt grants. State moves to DI 15TR1009 & 15TR1010- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (OWI-5th) 15CF176; amend ct 1 (OWI-6th) 15CF293. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense. State indicates Defendant is in the final stages of being deported. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF293 - WI State Prison Total of 4 yrs; Initial Confinement 1 yr; Extended Supervision 3 yrs. Credit 86 days. EXTENDED SUPERVISIN CONDITIONS: $600.00; Court Costs; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 years, as is the defendant himself; Crt orders 1/2 Price IID;  3 yrs dl revocation; AODA; Absolute Sobriety- drugs or alcohol; DNA Sample & DNA Surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF176 - SWH 3 yrs probation. Consecutive to 15CF293. CONDITIONS: $600.00; Court Costs; 6 months jail w/huber if eligible pursuant to jail criteria, consecutive to 15CF293; No days credit; 
Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 years, as is the defendant himself, concurrent to 15CF293; Crt orders 1/2 Price IID;  3 yrs dl revocation, concurrent to 15CF293; AODA; Absolute Sobriety; DNA Sample & DNA Surcharge.  Crt informs and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. Defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. Copy of CR 234 given to defendant after Court. COURT remands Defendant to Marathon County Sheriff Dept to be transported to Dodge Correction as reception site. Adjourned: 11:54am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case Called: 10:19am. Clerk: Denise.  INCLUDES 15CF293 Prelim - 15CF176, 15TR1009, 15TR1010- Tracking. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Interpreter, Teresa Berger sworn & interprets. Court proceeds with contested Preim on 15CF293. MCDSS Deputy Jacqueline White sworn & testifies.  COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. Plea: NOT GUILTY. Bond:  Continued. DATES: Set further dates. Adjourned: 10:36am.
INCLUDES 15CF293 & 15CF176 Shall not consume alcohol. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.

Clerk Deanna.
Case called:  1:45 pm
Includes cases 15CF176, 15CF293, 15TR1009, 15TR91 and 15TR1010.
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher.  Def appears with Atty Lou Ann Bohn and interpreter-sworn.
Initial appearance:
15CF293:  Waive reading, set prelim.  Time limits preserved.
COURT:  Same bond in 15CF293 as in 15CF176, covers both files.  Set prelim date.

Adj:  1:52 pm

Case Called: 4:14pm. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Interpreter, Susan Rascon sworn & interprets. Atty Bohn makes statement re: bond reduction. Court addresses name of Solero-Hernandez vs. Sotero-Hernandez. State indicates that Mexican dl is Sotero-Hernandez and WI ID is Solero-Hernandez. COURT notes that minutes shall reflect that information. State indicates new charges in 15CF293 will be heard next week. Court questions State & Defense further. Counel make statements. COURT denies bond modification. Adjourned: 4:20pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 8, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Defense Motion  for Modification of Bond - stj

Case Called: 9:47am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Interpreter, Darius Torres sworn & interprets. Trooper David Bertram sworn & testifies- identifies defendant. Arguments by Defense. Crt finds probable cause & binds defendant over for arraignment and trial. Information filed. W/R. PLEA: NOT GUILTY. Bond to Continue. DATES: PTC 3/25/15 @ 8:50am. BR 1. Adjourned: 10:05am.

Preliminary Hearing on March 4, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 25, 2015 at 08:50 am.
Final pre-trial on May 21, 2015 at 01:35 pm.
Jury Trial on June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Shall not consume alcohol. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
